column4: Can someone help me on how to switch my X Server to TrueColor mode (24 or 32 bit).
have you edited your xorg.conf?
in a terminal, type: sudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf
exactly like that
then go to the bottom. there is all the screen info there
asks for a password
put in your user password that you log in with
k it open but how to edit lol i am new
It looks like it isnt typing it, but it is, just type it and hit enter
ok, so scroll to the bottom, and look at the screen settings and just change the numbers from 16 bit to 24
Section "Screen"
that looks correct to me
you checked google? or your settings?
yes tryed google, and what settings you mean?
in system>preferences
for screen res?
just for Resolution and Refresh Rate
i have no idea, im sorry.
there is more likely to be more support for version 7.04. i would upgrade
just open a terminal and type sudo apt-get dist upgrade
E: Invalid operation dist
hmm, go to update manager and click distribution upgrade
